{"step_by_step_thinking": "Rabies is a disease that can be transmitted to humans through the bite of a rabid animal. According to the documents, rabies vaccines are recommended after exposure to a potential rabies virus, commonly caused by a dog bite or a bat bite. There is no mention in the documents that rabies vaccine should not be given in case of a rat, cat, dog, or monkey bite. In fact, it is recommended to get a rabies vaccine after a bite from any of these animals if they are suspected to be rabid.", "answer_choice": "None of the above"}
